item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: It was an overplay that was motivated by the fact that I was playing a handicap game. Though in hindsight, I think that my approach to 2 stone handicap games needs to be very different from say a 4 stone handicap. You bring up a good point though!
item.content:encoded: It was an overplay that was motivated by the fact that I was playing a handicap game. Though in hindsight, I think that my approach to 2 stone handicap games needs to be very different from say a 4 stone handicap. You bring up a good point though!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I used to hate giving them, but they are actually a fun challenge now. And especially with me starting to review the pro simuls I did in Go Congress, I'm beginning to see how one should approach handicap games as White. But more on that later!
item.content:encoded: I used to hate giving them, but they are actually a fun challenge now. And especially with me starting to review the pro simuls I did in Go Congress, I’m beginning to see how one should approach handicap games as White. But more on that later!

item.title: By: mhl
item.dc:creator: mhl
item.description: Hi Ben. I haven't seen move 9 before (your pincer at K17). It appears to be an overplay, because when Black jumps out, you have two weak groups to manage and she only has one.
item.content:encoded: Hi Ben. I haven’t seen move 9 before (your pincer at K17). It appears to be an overplay, because when Black jumps out, you have two weak groups to manage and she only has one.

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: Probably Crunch or Kit Kat. You?
